result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen M Pichelman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Continue current therapy program. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Costs waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Continue current therapy program. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen M Pichelman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stephen M Pichelman in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
St - Plea to Ct 1 as amended to misdm, and Ct 2 as charged
Rights given
P - Guilty
BTC:  Finding of guilt Ct 1 as amended and Ct 2 as charged

Cts 1 & 2 - Probation 2 yrs, sent w/held - conc
No alc/cs
AODA assmt and follow rec's
Continue current therapy program
Court costs
Provide DNA - pay fee
(Waive costs on Ct 2)

May petition for expungment after successful completion of probation.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.

Defendant Stephen M Pichelman in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Stephen M Pichelman in court with attorney Patrick Kiernan Cafferty.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.
